message.content:
cs.HC, cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

This paper presents a novel approach for position tracking in virtual reality using commodity WiFi infrastructure. As such, it could fit into several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

Firstly, cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is a likely category as the paper focuses on improving the user experience of VR, which is a key aspect of HCI research. 

Secondly, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is also a likely category as the paper leverages WiFi infrastructure for tracking purposes. 

Thirdly, cs.MM (Multimedia) is a possible category as the paper deals with improving the multimedia experience of VR. 

Fourthly, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a possible category as the paper proposes a new system for position tracking in VR. 

Finally, cs.IT (Information Theory) is a possible category as the paper uses WiFi signals to estimate position, which involves signal processing and information theory concepts.
